message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class ReverseWords {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        // Set up input
        Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Type something here");
        String sentence = input.nextLine();

        // Set up StringTokenizer
        StringTokenizer tokens = new StringTokenizer(sentence);

        // Set up array to store words
        String[] words = new String[tokens.countTokens()];

        // Store words in reverse order
        int index = tokens.countTokens() - 1;
        while (tokens.hasMoreTokens()) {
            words[index] = tokens.nextToken();
            index--;
        }

        // Print words in reverse order
        for (String word : words) {
            System.out.print(word + " ");
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are creating a new String array for each word in the sentence. This is why you are getting an "index out of bounds" error. To fix this, you can create a String array with the size equal to the number of tokens in the sentence before the loop. Then, you can store each word in the array in reverse order using a while loop. Finally, you can print the words in reverse order using a for-each loop.
